RESEARCH MATERIAL
4
Fubl*
No,
R-l The National Association of Educational Broadcasters: A History -
Harold E. Hill
A survey of the development of the NAEB from its founding in
1925 to the present day. (M. S. Thesis: University of Illinois,
1954.) October 1, 1954* 65 pp* Paper. $1.00
R-2 Some Comparisons Between British and American Television (Research
Project Report #2} - John T. Suchy
Excerpts from a thesis presented in partial fulfillment of the
requirements for the M.A. degree in Journalism at the State
University of Iowa. October, 1954* 22 pp. Paper. $1.00
R-3 The Administrative Problems on the 10-Watt Educational FM Station -
(Research Project Report #3) - Lowell G. Perry
A study of the 10-watt FM station: organization, policy,
programming, music activities, equipment, engineering, budget,
etc. October, 1954* 30 pp. Paper. $1.00
R-16 Children^ Programs on Educational TV Stations - William G. Dochterman
An analysis of childrens programming on ETV stations in the
United States, as of May 1, 1956. June 30, 1956. 35 pp. Paper.
$1.00
R-17 Conducting A Telephone Coincidental Survey - (Research Project Report
#4) - Samuel L. Becker
A study of the telephone survey of listeners to educational
broadcasting. December, 1958. 15 pp. Paper. $1,00
